About the Center

Information, Directions, and Visits to the IMF Center - Briefings for Visitors & Visits to the IMF

Information, Directions, and Visits to the IMF Center

Hours of operation:
10:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Monday through Friday
Closed weekends and holidays

Telephone: (202) 623-8695
Fax: (202) 589-8695
E-mail: imfcenter@imf.org

2 blocks southwest of the Farragut West Metro Station
4 blocks southwest from the Farragut North Metro Station

Directions and map (31KB pdf file)

Use the free Adobe Acrobat Reader to view PDF files.

To be placed on the IMF Center's mailing list to receive announcements of special exhibits or public programs please write to:

IMF Center
720 19th Street, NW
Washington, D.C. 20431
E-mail: imfcenter@imf.org
Attention: Mailing List

D.C. Mayor Anthony
Williams and IMF
Center staff

Mini-theater and DVD programs

Currently showing in DVD format:
Millennium: The IMF in the New Century
Learn how the IMF is evolving as a global institution to meet the challenge of promoting macroeconomic stability, economic growth and poverty reduction.

Out of the Ashes
The Origins of the IMF

Briefings for Visitors & Visits to the IMF

Students at an IMF briefing

Online Form to request a briefing for your group

IMF Speakers Bureau:
Public Affairs, 700 19th Street, NW
Washington, D.C. 20431
Tel. (202) 623-8695; Fax:(202) 589-8695
email: imfspeaker@imf.org

Please provide as much information as possible, such as requested date and time of visit, size and background of the group, topics of interest, and other relevant information, as well as your address, telephone number, and name of contact person.
